titleStmt.title: William A. Franks to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5872

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: Your petitioner W A Franks says that at the Oct term of the Grant Circuit Court for 1864 he was fined by a Jury of Said Court in the Sum of Five hundred dollars He says the only proof agst him was made by a woman who is well known to be a meddlesome woman amongt the neighbours of the neighbourhood in which she lives That the Jury was not acquainted with the character of the witness He further says that he is a poor man without any property and will not be able to pay the Same at all He represents that he is a hard working man and willing to pay his debt and will certainly pay to the atto for the Commonwealth that part of the fine belonging to him but will be entirely unable to pay the whole of the fine They say he was drafted in the last draft executed in Grant County and had to pay his commutation which entirely exhausted his means -- He therefore prays Your Excellency to remit so much of the fine as you have power to remit and by so doing you will confer a great favour upon your petitioner -- Oct 27th 1864 --
The undersigned say they are acquainted with W A Franks and that they believe the statements in the petition to your Excellency are true Oct 27th 1864 --
I do not know the parties but heard the testimony & think the fine was excessive for the wrong charged

Tho N Lindsey
Jarves M Lawrence
W H Childers
